page.title: 03PENTLAND HILL SHEEP FARM
page.content: THE BUSIEST TIME OF YEAR FOR A HILL SHEEP FARMER IS FROM MID APRIL TO THE END OF MAY BECAUSE THAT IS THE TIME THE LAMBS ARE BORN.A BUSY DAY FOR A FARMER IS RISING AT 5'OCLOCK AND AFTER A CUP OF TEA GOING ROUND THE HILL TOPS AND ALSO INSPECTING THE SHEEP IN THE FARMS.LAMBS IN A HILL SHEEP FARM DO NOT USUALLY DIE VERY OFTEN ABOUT 1 IN EVERY 1 HUNDRED.USUALLY THERE ARE ABOUT 700 BREEDING EWES ,180 EWE HOGGS(LAMBS FROM 6 TO 15 YEARS OLD)AND ABOUT 16 TO 20 RAMS.THE NORMAL LIFE FOR A EWE IS 8 YEARS. FARMERS KEEP THEM UNTIL THEY ARE 6 YEARS OLD THEN THEY ARE SOLD AT THE MARKET AND TAKEN TO AN ARABLE FARM FOR ONE OR TWO YEARS.HIGH UP THERE CAN BE A LOT OF SEVERE FROST AND LOTS OF SNOW.STRONG GALES REGULARLY SWEEP THE FARM WHICH IS OVER{500}METRES IN HEIGHT. {
